title: Project Planning and Management
description: Define project scope, objectives, and timeline. Establish project management processes and communication channels.

title: Requirements Gathering and Analysis for Narrative Therapy AI
description: Conduct user research, gather requirements, analyze existing narrative therapy techniques (specifically focusing on RFC 7182 - Narrative Therapy for Digital Systems), best practices, and provide a comprehensive report detailing the findings to guide the project team. Collaborate with mental health professionals, UX/UI designers, and technical experts as needed. This includes code architects, frontend developers, backend developers, database specialists, devops engineers, QA testers, security specialists, and technical writers.

title: System Architecture Design
description:
Design the overall system architecture, including the AI model, user interface, data storage components, and integration with third-party services (if applicable). Consider the following aspects:

1. AI Model Architecture: Determine the appropriate type of AI model (e.g., transformer-based, RNN, etc.) and the specific architecture (e.g., GPT, BERT, etc.) for the narrative therapy task. Consider the model's ability to understand and generate natural language, as well as its capacity for emotional intelligence and context understanding.

2. User Interface: Design the user interface for both the client-side (e.g., web or mobile app) and the therapist/admin interface. Consider the user experience, accessibility, and intuitive navigation. Include a section on responsive design to ensure compatibility with various devices. Additionally, consider incorporating feedback mechanisms for continuous improvement.

3. Data Storage: Determine the data storage requirements, including user data, session transcripts, and any other relevant data. Consider data privacy, security, and compliance with relevant regulations (e.g., HIPAA). Store data securely using encryption and ensure regular backups for disaster recovery. Additionally, consider implementing a data retention policy to manage data storage costs and anonymization techniques to protect user identities.

4. Integration: Identify any potential third-party services or APIs that may need to be integrated, such as natural language processing services, sentiment analysis tools, or knowledge bases. Ensure compatibility with the chosen technology stack and evaluate the cost and impact of these integrations on system performance.

5. Scalability and Performance: Ensure that the architecture can handle increasing user loads and data volumes while maintaining acceptable performance levels. Implement caching strategies for improved response times and horizontal scalability for seamless expansion, considering the use of cloud services such as AWS or Azure. Additionally, consider load balancing mechanisms to distribute traffic efficiently.

6. Security and Privacy: Implement appropriate security measures to protect user data and ensure compliance with relevant regulations and industry standards. Incorporate features such as authentication, authorization, and secure communication protocols. Address concerns around data breaches, DDoS attacks, and unauthorized access by implementing intrusion detection systems and regularly updating security patches.

7. Monitoring and Logging: Incorporate monitoring and logging mechanisms to track system performance, identify issues, and facilitate debugging and maintenance. Implement alert systems for critical errors and performance degradation. Consider using tools such as Splunk or Elasticsearch for log management, and implementing SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) solutions for enhanced security.

8. Accessibility: Ensure the user interface is accessible to individuals with disabilities by following web accessibility guidelines such as WCAG 2.1. Include a section on testing for color contrast, text readability, and keyboard navigation, as well as screen reader compatibility.

9. Documentation: Provide comprehensive documentation for developers, testers, and future maintenance teams, including architecture diagrams, API documentation, and usage instructions. Incorporate code comments to improve understanding and maintainability, and consider implementing a system for auto-documenting changes in the codebase.

10. Performance Testing and Optimization: Perform performance tests on the system to ensure it can handle the expected user load and data volumes. Optimize the system where necessary to achieve optimal performance levels, and incorporate stress testing to simulate high traffic scenarios.

Rfc State: READY_FOR_APPROVAL
